metadata.title: CVE-2013-5653 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The getenv and filenameforall functions in Ghostscript 9.10 ignore the"-dSAFER" argument, which allows remote attackers to read data via acrafted postscript file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2').
